channel.title: Recent posts to is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
channel.description: Recent posts to is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .

item.title: is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
item.description:
So, one has to check the starting bytes of every megabyte of the data file . . .?

You need to know which cluster contains the data you want. My understanding is that the ZIM headers contain this information. You need to study the ZIM format in detail or use an existing ZIM library.

Note that while I have heard about the ZIM format a few times before, I'm not really familiar with it and I have written no ZIM code. The ZIM format can use XZ compression inside the ZIM file (a ZIM file is not an XZ file). You sound interested in the ZIM layer, not XZ, so I cannot help you much.

Could you point me to some java code doing something similar to "xz --list" for me to take it from there?

SeekableXZInputStream in XZ for Java does the decoding part and provides functions to get the information. You need a few lines of code to print the information. Doing this doesn't seem useful with your ZIM problem though.
item.dc:creator: Lasse Collin

item.title: is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
item.description: Could you point me to some java code doing something similar to "xz --list" for me to take it from there?
item.dc:creator: Albretch Mueller

item.title: is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
item.description:
clusters are typically about one megabyte

So, one has to check the starting bytes of every megabyte of the data file . . .?

Also, I wanted to show to you/topically every one, what I mean by using xz's "--list" command option, but I am getting "File format not recognized" (file Unix utility reported the files as "data"):

https://dumps.wikimedia.org/other/kiwix/zim/wikipedia/wikipedia_de_medicine_nopic_2018-10.zim

http://download.kiwix.org/zim/wikibooks_en_all_nopic.zim

even after checking the listed md5sum.

I found very few and not that helpful references to such problems online.

How do you troubleshoot/fix such problems?
item.dc:creator: Albretch Mueller

item.title: is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
item.description:
I think so. I quickly looked at this: https://wiki.openzim.org/wiki/ZIM_file_format

You may need to decompress a little more than the actual file you want because the format uses clusters (a bit like solid compression in .7z). The linked page says that clusters are typically about one megabyte.
item.dc:creator: Lasse Collin

item.title: is it possible to list, selectively extract/decompress files contained in a zim file? . . .
item.description:
the zip file format has a way to descriptively list the metadata of the contained files (its "zip entries") and selectively extract just the files you need without having to decompress the whole file.

is this possible with a zim file?
item.dc:creator: Albretch Mueller
